subject: Productivity
title: Remote Work After the Pandemic
description: A fast breakdown of Remote Work After the Pandemic for builders.

hook.text: In February 2020, about 5% of US workers worked remotely. By April, it was over 60%.

buildup.text: The pandemic forced a global experiment in remote work. Companies that resisted had no choice.

discovery.text: Stanford research found remote workers were 13% more productive and quit 50% less often.

twist.text: But isolation, burnout, and collaboration challenges emerged. Remote work solved some problems and created others.

punchline.text: The office didn't die. It became optional.
